intro: Tibouchina hygrophila, commonly known as the Brazilian flame bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Tibouchina hygrophila thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
